text: - My name is Volker Mueller,

and I'm a senior solutions
architect at AWS.
So I started working for AWS in 2019.

So it's a little bit over
three years right now,
but I'm using AWS technology since 2011.
I had a couple of my own startups.
I was a co-founder and a CTO

for in total three
startups in Mexico City.
And before that, I lived in New York City

and worked on Wall Street
for a hedge fund company.
And back then, everything was still
on-premise data center architecture,
a little bit of virtualization.

But because I didn't
understand most of it,
what the people were asking me from,
so I had to test it out myself.
And instead of spooling up my own server
and asking for having a server running,

I went to AWS and I spooled
up my first EC2 instances
for testing purposes for trying it out.

And that's the cool thing
about AWS, mind you.
Try something, and you turn it off,
and you're not incurring any cost.
When I started my own companies,
I was naturally going to AWS again

to actually build the
technology for my startups.

When I had the chance actually
to join the team at AWS,
it was just like something for me
that I always wanted to do anyway, a lot.
I can relate to these startup founders

and these CTOs that
wanna do more with less.
So that's actually also my passion.

So I really like to
help them reducing costs
and make their money last longer.

I believe that AWS is a
place built for entrepreneurs

and intrapreneurs
because we are encouraged
on a daily basis to think big
and think outside of the box.

And it's very much like
it is in a startup anyway.
Why would you wanna work for AWS?
Because this company is at the forefront
of these type of technologies.
We built the cloud and being able to learn
and being able to grow as a person.
I'm already 51 years old,
but I'm still growing on a daily basis.

And that is something
that will never stop.
It's always day one, as we say.
(upbeat music)
